definition.name: NXms_recon

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n_t_two
symbol.doc: The number of assumed triple junction projections aka triple points.

definition.doc:
Base class to describe discretized (micro)structural features of a material.
One instance of this base class can be used to describe the current configuration the base class does not include time-dependent descriptions for the sake of clarity and because of the fact that virtually all simulations or experiments probe time by sampling. Therefore, time-dependent state descriptions should be realized with creating a set of :ref:`NXms_snapshot_set` with instances of :ref:`NXms_snapshot` using e.g. :ref:`NXms_recon` base class instances.

group.name: configuration
group.doc: The configuration and parameterization of the reconstruction algorithm whereby the microstructural features were identified.

field.name: dimensionality
field.doc:
Dimensionality of the analysis.
This field can be used e.g. by a research data management system to identify if the described feature set specifies a one-, two-, or three-dimensional feature set.

field.name: algorithm
field.doc: Which algorithm is used to reconstruct the features.

field.name: disorientation_threshold
field.doc: Threshold to define at which disorientation angle to assume two crystalline regions have a significant orientation difference which warrants to argue that there is an interface between the two regions.

group.name: crystal_projections
group.doc: Projections of crystals on the sample surface as typically characterized with optical or electron microscopy.

attribute.name: discretization
attribute.doc:
Reference to lines(NXcg_polyline_set) which supports the discretized shape of each cross-sectioned crystal.
Most microscopy techniques support to generate only a two-dimensional representation (projection) of the characterized material.
For true volumetric techniques use the specifically specialized crystals :ref:`NXms_feature_set` instead. See stereology literature for more details e.g. E.E. Underwood's book entitled Quantitative Stereology

field.name: number_of_crystals
field.doc: Number of crystals.

field.name: crystal_identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer offset whereby the identifier of the first member of the set differs from zero.
Identifiers can be defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing identifiers are defined on the interval :math:`[identifier\_offset, identifier\_offset + c - 1]`.

field.name: crystal_identifier
field.doc: Identifier used for crystals for explicit indexing.

field.name: number_of_phases
field.doc: How many phases are distinguished

field.name: phase_identifier_offset
field.doc: Integer offset whereby the identifier of the first member of the set differs from zero.

field.name: phase_identifier
field.doc: Identifier used for phase for explicit indexing.

field.name: boundary_contact
field.doc: True, if the crystal makes contact with the edge of the ROI, false otherwise.

field.name: orientation_spread
field.doc: Average disorientation angle between individual orientation of the crystal at probed positions (weighted by area of that position) versus the average disorientation of the crystal.

field.name: area
field.doc: Calibrated area of surrounded by the polyline about each crystal.

group.name: interface_projections
group.doc: Projections of grain or phase boundaries as typically sectioned with optical or electron microscopy characterization.

attribute.name: discretization
attribute.doc:
Reference to lines(NXcg_polyline_set) which supports the discretized shape of each cross-sectioned crystal.
Set of tuples of polyline segments which build the interface.

field.name: crystals
field.doc: Set of pairs of crystal_identifier resolved via depends_on which are adjacent to each interface.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: The specific crystal_projections(NXms_feature_set) instance to resolve crystal identifier.

field.name: triple_points
field.doc: Set of pairs of triple_point_identifier which the interface connects. For 2D projections of 3D microstructural features a triple point is physically only the projection of a triple line.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: The specific triple_line_projections(NXms_feature_set) instance whereby to resolve triple_point identifier.

field.name: length
field.doc:
The length of the interface.
This is not necessarily the same as the length of the individual polyline segments whereby the interface is discretized.
The actual coordinate system whereby the geometry is calibrated with real physical dimensions is typically documented by the depends_on attribute of the respective NXcg_primitive_set. This depends_on attribute should point explicitly to an instance of a :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` to support users as much as possible with interpreting how and where the lines are located in the reference frame.

field.name: interface_identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer offset whereby the identifier of the first member of the set differs from zero.
Identifiers can be defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing identifiers are defined on the interval :math:`[identifier\_offset, identifier\_offset + c - 1]`.

field.name: interface_identifier
field.doc: Identifier for each interface using explicit indexing.

group.name: triple_line_projections
group.doc:
Projections of triple lines as typically characterized with optical or electron microscopy.
Mind that most specimens are thermo-chemo-mechanically treated before they are characterized. Therefore, the projected crystal defects are have physically no longer the same structure as in the bulk.
Examples are manifest as effects such as thermal grooving, or relaxation effects of an intersection between a triple line that is cut by the specimen surface as these defects are then exposed typically to a different atmosphere and hence have different thermodynamic boundary conditions than of their true volumetric defects in the bulk.

attribute.name: discretization
attribute.doc: Reference to points(NXcg_point_set) which supports the locations of these triple points.

field.name: number_of_triple_points
field.doc: Number of triple points.

field.name: triple_point_identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer offset whereby the identifier of the first member of the set differs from zero.
Identifiers can be defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing identifiers are defined on the interval :math:`[identifier\_offset, identifier\_offset + c - 1]`.

field.name: triple_point_identifier
field.doc: Identifier for each triple point using explicit indexing.

field.name: location
field.doc: Set of triple point identifiers.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: The relevant points(NXcg_point_set) instance whereby to resolve interface identifiers.

field.name: interfaces
field.doc: Set of triplets of identifier of line-like features. Each triplet resolves which three interface projections the triple point connects.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: The specific interface_projections(NXms_feature_set) instance whereby to resolve interface identifiers.

field.name: polylines
field.doc: Triplet of identifier of polyline segments. Each triplet resolves which three segments of polyline segments the triple junction connects.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: The specific lines(NXcg_polyline_set) instance to resolve polyline segments.
